name: ey-blockchain
title: Enterprise API Platform
body: Led international agile team to plan, define & develop EYs enterprise blockchain platform based on a federated microservice architecture on top of Azure cloud.
problem: EY needed a scalable and secure enterprise blockchain platform to meet client demands and market trends.
stakes: Risk of falling behind competitors in blockchain adoption and losing potential clients.
approach: Developed a federated microservice architecture on Azure cloud, leveraging an international agile team to ensure scalability and integration.
outcome: Successfully launched a robust blockchain platform, improving client offerings and market competitiveness.
considerations: Addressed regulatory compliance and security challenges inherent in blockchain technology.
tags: financial, crypto, api design, platform, product strategy

name: redbook-solutions
title: Store Management Platform & Apps
body: Led end-to-end design, development, and delivery of store management SaaS app platform on iOS, Android, Web capturing millions of images from 80,000 locations to the AWS cloud, atop a digital transformation workflow processing 1000s of PDFs  month.
problem: Challenges in managing operations across 80,000 locations with inefficiencies in image capture and document workflows.
stakes: Operational inefficiencies leading to potential revenue loss and reduced productivity.
approach: Designed and delivered a multi-platform SaaS app to streamline operations using AWS cloud for large-scale data management and transformation workflows.
outcome: Delivered a highly efficient store management platform, improving productivity and data handling.
considerations: Ensured scalability for vast data volumes and compatibility across platforms.
tags: retail, store management, aws, native apps, web app, full stack, multi-platform, community, analytics, data visualization, api design, platform

name: boston-regtech
title: Fintech Platform for Regulatory Compliance
body: Create an investigation platform for financial institutions to perform smart investigations on behalf of FinCen. Apply analytic, visualization, and machine learning techniques to optimize flow to generate SARs.
problem: Financial institutions lacked a streamlined platform for regulatory compliance and SAR generation.
stakes: Risk of non-compliance, financial penalties, and inefficiencies in investigative processes.
approach: Created a platform integrating analytics, visualization, and machine learning for smart investigations and SAR generation.
outcome: Implemented a regulatory compliance tool that improved efficiency and accuracy in generating SARs.
considerations: Focused on meeting stringent regulatory standards and protecting sensitive financial data.

name: symtrend
title: Patient Symptom Tracking App
body: Led team to develop pioneering platform for mobile tracking of patient symptoms.
problem: Patients struggled to track symptoms effectively, hindering health management and provider communication.
stakes: Poor patient engagement and suboptimal health outcomes due to lack of reliable tracking solutions.
approach: Developed a mobile app with user-friendly interfaces and data visualization tools for effective symptom monitoring and sharing with healthcare providers.
outcome: Enabled better health management and communication through an innovative symptom tracking app.
considerations: Ensured compliance with healthcare data privacy regulations and accessibility for diverse users.
tags: healthcare, full stack, visualization, platform, native apps, web app, automation

name: channelfit
title: Fitness and Nutrition App
body: Led team to design and develop on-line system to create personalized diet and workout plans.
problem: Individuals needed personalized, accessible fitness and nutrition plans to meet their health goals.
stakes: Failure to meet consumer demand for customizable health and wellness solutions, risking brand relevance.
approach: Built an online system to generate personalized diet and workout plans based on user data, ensuring user engagement and adherence.
outcome: Delivered a personalized fitness and nutrition app, improving user satisfaction and outcomes.
considerations: Prioritized data privacy and adaptability for varied fitness levels and goals.
tags: healthcare, visualization, web app, community, automation

name: verizon-dti
title: Interactive Circuit Diagnostic System
body: Led team to design & develop a unified platform for testing all Verizon Circuits.
problem: Verizon required a unified diagnostic platform for efficient circuit testing and maintenance.
stakes: Risk of prolonged network downtime and customer dissatisfaction due to inefficient circuit diagnostics.
approach: Designed and developed an interactive diagnostic system to unify circuit testing across Verizon's network, enhancing maintenance efficiency.
outcome: Improved network reliability and reduced maintenance time with a comprehensive diagnostic platform.
considerations: Integrated diverse circuit types and minimized operational disruption during deployment.
tags: telecomm, full stack, api, platform, native apps

name: baupost
title: New Investment Warning System
body: Led design & development of a system to track compliance constraints on hedge fund investments.
problem: Baupost needed a system to ensure compliance with investment regulations to avoid breaches.
stakes: Financial and reputational risk due to potential regulatory violations.
approach: Designed a system to track compliance constraints on investments in real-time, ensuring adherence to regulations and policies.
outcome: Implemented a compliance tracking system, protecting the firm from regulatory breaches and enhancing operational transparency.
considerations: Adaptable to evolving regulatory environments and complex investment instruments.

name: christensen-institute
title: Business Innovation Community System
body: Worked directly with Clay Christensen (Harvard Business School) to productize his vision for collaborative business innovation, later reformulated into dx.MBA innovation platform.
problem: The institute sought to make collaborative business innovation principles accessible to professionals.
stakes: Potential stagnation in innovation dissemination and loss of relevance in the field of disruptive innovation.
approach: Productized disruptive innovation concepts into an accessible platform (dx.MBA), fostering collaboration and practical application among professionals.
outcome: Launched a community platform promoting business innovation, collaboration, and application of disruptive principles.
considerations: Preserved the integrity of foundational theories while ensuring accessibility to diverse audiences.

name: peoplefluent
title: Mobile Apps for Talent Management
body: Built a suite of talent management apps for iPad for augmenting clients HRM SaaS offering.
problem: Peoplefluent needed to enhance its HRM SaaS offering with mobile solutions to meet modern workforce demands.
stakes: Risk of losing market share due to lack of mobile accessibility in talent management solutions.
approach: Built iPad apps that complemented the HRM SaaS offerings, providing enhanced features for talent management on the go.
outcome: Increased competitiveness by augmenting HRM solutions with mobile applications.
considerations: Prioritized usability for HR professionals and integration with existing systems.

name: appstore
title: 100+ iOS Apps
body: Led conception, design, development, and release of more than 100 Apps.
problem: The AppStore required a diverse set of high-quality apps to meet the growing demands of iOS users and maintain its competitive edge.
stakes: Maintaining user engagement and satisfaction by offering a wide variety of applications.
approach: Led end-to-end app development from conception to release, ensuring quality, functionality, and user-centric design.
outcome: Successfully launched over 100 diverse and high-quality apps, boosting user engagement and platform appeal.
considerations: Ensured apps adhered to Apple's guidelines and addressed diverse user needs.

name: fidelity-pm
title: Portfolio Management Framework & API
body: Developed SDK for a component framework to be used by 100 internal developers.
problem: Fidelity needed a robust SDK framework to streamline development and improve collaboration among internal developers.
stakes: Enhancing developer productivity and ensuring consistency in application development.
approach: Developed a flexible SDK component framework tailored to Fidelity's internal developer needs.
outcome: Enabled streamlined development and improved collaboration among 100 internal developers.
considerations: Ensured the framework was flexible, scalable, and aligned with Fidelity's operational goals.

name: cme
title: Interactive Trade Clearing Platform
body: Developed trade clearing component for CME Future and Option Trades on Instant Messages.
problem: CME required an efficient clearing platform to handle trades and reduce settlement times.
stakes: Ensuring smooth trade execution and minimizing financial risks associated with delays.
approach: Developed a trade clearing component integrated with Instant Messaging systems for faster and more transparent trade settlements.
outcome: Improved trade clearing efficiency and reduced settlement times, enhancing market reliability.
considerations: Ensured compliance with financial regulations and optimized for real-time performance.

name: coniferpoint
title: Computational Medicine Discovery Platform
problem: ConiferPoint aimed to accelerate computational medicine discoveries by leveraging data-driven insights.
stakes: Advancing medical research and discovery processes to address critical healthcare challenges.
approach: Developed a platform integrating computational tools for medicine discovery, enabling collaboration and data sharing.
outcome: Facilitated advancements in computational medicine through an innovative discovery platform.
considerations: Addressed data privacy and compliance concerns in handling sensitive medical information.
tags: healthcare, web apps, api, architecture, e-commerce

name: verizon-tips
title: Real-Time QoS Monitoring System
body: Designed and developed real-time system to monitor and visualize network quality of service for the entire Verizon management network.
problem: Verizon needed a real-time monitoring system to ensure optimal network quality of service (QoS).
stakes: Maintaining customer satisfaction and minimizing service disruptions through improved network reliability.
approach: Designed a real-time QoS monitoring system with advanced visualization for network performance metrics.
outcome: Enhanced network reliability and customer satisfaction through proactive QoS monitoring.
considerations: Ensured scalability to handle large-scale network monitoring and seamless integration with existing systems.
